metadata.synopsis: WYR South checkpoint primary guard dialog. A watcher checks if you have been in conflict with a scrying eye, and attacks if warranted.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to larian://bookmark?name=New%20Bookmark&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=4.163053;50.366581;2.494043&camTarget=4.179307;50.032921;3.436596Walk towards the bridge gates

55.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
55.text: Stand ready for examination. This won't take a moment.

107.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
107.context: InternalNodeContext: Player has gotten through the checkpoint already

139.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
139.text: Halt! By orders of Lord Gortash, refugees are no longer allowed in the city. Turn around.
139.context: InternalNodeContext: Checkpoint main dialog. Player hasn't yet gotten admission.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I can take care of myself. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I am Wyll Ravengard. I trust you will let me through?

162.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
162.text: Ravengard? More like the ghastliest tiefling south of Neverwinter.

63.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
63.text: Ravengard? Yes, of course - pardon the trouble. A cult army's on the move and we know for a fact there are spies among the exiles.

12.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
12.text: Now - please open your eyes, keep your body still. This will take but a moment.
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steel Watcher walks a little bit forward from under the gate arches.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I've lived in this cess-pit longer than you've been alive. We can compare stinks, if you would like?

137.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
137.text: Well, do you have the means to support yourself? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

114.speaker: Wyll
114.text: My good lady. I am Wyll Ravengard. I will not pay to enter my own city.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I can take care of myself. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

106.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
106.text: Right. Article 30.1.5 of the Council's Decree on Extraordinary Wartime Measures. I am confiscating that. The city thanks you for your contribution.
106.context: InternalNodeContext: Gold is still in player's inventory

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Why do you need my name?

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *Your parasite stirs. From the construct, you feel connection. Resonance.*
133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player squints as they feel their tadpole stir.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: What in the hells is that thing?

91.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
91.text: I am a Steel Watcher, citizen. Here to serve the people of Baldur's Gate in the name of Lord Enver Gortash.

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: My good lady. I am Wyll Ravengard. My business is the city's business.

130.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
130.text: Ravengard? More like the ghastliest tiefling south of Neverwinter.

39.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
39.text: I'm in no mood for jests. Business?

127.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
127.text: The Duke's son? Of course - excuse the trouble. No room for exiles, no mercy for spies. Lord Gortash's orders.

75.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
75.text: Wyll Ravengard? Of course, of course - the city is always open to you. But I'm afraid you'll still need to comply with new protocol. By Lord Gortash's command.

132.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
132.text: Please open your eyes, keep your body still. This will take but a moment.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Steel Watcher walks a little bit forward from under the gate arches.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: What makes my business your business?

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I have an urgent message for Duke Ulder Ravengard.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I was born and raised in Baldur's Gate. This is my home.

165.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
165.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steel Watcher walks a little bit forward from under the gate arches.NodeContext: "Uh-huh" as in, "Yes, I heard you and am going with it."

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Do as she says. Stand still.

22.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The steel watcher steps forward and begins to scan the player's eyes.
There is NO mindmeld, because player is NOT tadpoled.

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *Behind the Watcher's gaze, a presence awakens. You may not carry a mind flayer parasite, but it sees you - knows you.*

145.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The steel watcher steps forward and begins to scan the player's eyes.
There is NO mindmeld, because player is NOT tadpoled. ? 

context copied over by jack O'Flynn

161.speaker: Narrator
161.text: *Behind the Watcher's gaze, a presence awakens. You are seen, you are known.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Your infernal machinery seems to snap to attention, almost singing in recognition.*

150.speaker: Karlach
150.text: Whoa. My engine. It's almost... I don't know. Buzzing. Like it's paying attention.

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *Your party's prior transgressions are reflected in its stare, as witnessed by the cult's ever-alert scrying eyes.*

47.speaker: Narrator
47.text: *It has heard the howls of slaughtered goblins.*

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *It has seen the deep shadows of Grymforge, and the stone floors left bloodied.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *It knows the cold walls of Moonrise Towers, and the cultists who fell there.*

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *The Watcher speaks directly into your mind with a voice like poisoned honey.*

96.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
96.text: You are marked for special treatment. Not simply an enemy of the people, but an enemy of the Absolute. Come quietly, or die.

141.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
141.text: You are marked for special treatment. A defective Steel Watcher. Not simply an enemy of the people, but an enemy of the Absolute. Come quietly, or die.

4.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
4.text: You are marked for special treatment. Not simply an enemy of the people, but an enemy of the Absolute. Come quietly, or die.

29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld with steel watcher ends

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Why do you call me a Steel Watcher? I'm not one of you.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *There is a moment's pause. The presence reevaluates you.*

7.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
7.text: Apologies, citizen. No offence intended. Welcome to Baldur's Gate. I hope you have a nice day.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steel Watcher walks back to the gate

19.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
19.text: The Watch has spoken. You may pass.

31.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
31.text: Your peaceful surrender has been noted. You will be transferred to Wyrm's Rock Prison where you will await further sentencing.

10.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
10.text: Please comply now, citizen. I will interpret any further hesitation as resistance.

11.speaker: GROUP_Act3_WYR_GnomeThrowerAtCheckpoint
11.text: Eat this, you pile of junk!

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *You have felt this presence before, in the unblinking void of a scrying eye.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *The scrying eyes have borne witness to your actions - and they reveal no violations.*

144.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
144.text: Your record is clean, citizen Fluffington. Keep it that way and enjoy your visit to Baldur's Gate.
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steel Watcher walks back to the gate

158.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
158.text: Your record is clean, citizen. Keep it that way and enjoy your visit to Baldur's Gate.
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: Steel Watcher walks back to the gate

84.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
84.text: The Watcher will communicate with our new intelligence directorate. They'll determine if you're a threat to the city.

99.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
99.text: Upstanding citizens have no reason to fear. And you are an upstanding citizen, aren't you?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: On second thought, I'll come back later.

45.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
45.text: Shifty eyes expose lies. Entry refused.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I need to pass. I was born and raised in Baldur's Gate. This is my home.

131.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
131.text: Then you can wait with the rest.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Baldur's Gate is my city, my home.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Please, let me pass. Baldur's Gate is my city, my home.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I'm here to enlist - figured the Fist could use a hand.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: I'm just here to purchase an eldritch tome of immense magical power.

101.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
101.text: Sure, and I'm the Marshal of the Flaming Fist. Lying gets you nowhere - entry refused.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Never mind. I'll be on my way.

146.speaker: Jaheira
146.text: I'm a herbalist by trade, Saer Fist. My assistants and I were out collecting blooms for that rub-rot going around. Nasty business. Contagious.
146.context: NodeContext: Change in demeanour to polite, unassuming older woman - a guard is challenging her to enter the city and she's trying to fob them off without giving any real details. 'Saer Fist' is a polite form of address to flaming fist.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: You are scamming me. Give me my money back.

85.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
85.text: Take it up with the Duke if you don't like it. Now, your name?

24.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
24.text: What's this? Off with you. Only the self-sufficient may enter.
24.context: InternalNodeContext: Player hid gold before choosing this option

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm here on pilgrimage - the temples will support me.

123.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
123.text: I'm afraid Article 30.1.7 stipulates that religious or spiritual assertions cannot count towards one's proof of self-sufficiency.

164.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
164.text: I will repeat - for the last time, may I add - do you have means to support yourself? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

81.speaker: Player
81.text: Oh, I have help from the other side if I ever need support.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: I don't need any money to support myself. I live off what I find in nature.

74.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
74.text: Then you don't need to be in the city. Next!

17.speaker: Player
17.text: I'm out of money but I'll get some soon.

71.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
71.text: Sure. Now turn around and stop wasting my time. Next!

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I have urgent business in the city.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You have no idea who you are talking to. Let me through or I'll kill you.

52.speaker: Gauntlet Edwynna
52.text: Really? Here I thought this was going to be a boring day.
